intro: Loncomelos koprulense, commonly known as the Koprul Mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
